700262f-a.title: Bronx: 180th Street (East) - Vyse Avenue
700262f-a.text:
East 180th Street, south side, between Vyse and Bryant Aves., showing the Beck Memorial Presbyterian Church. This is a view of the east side of the church as seen from Bryant Ave. (foreground) across a vacant lot.
July 20, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

700260f-a.title: Bronx: 180th Street (East) - Vyse Avenue
700260f-a.text:
(1)
East 180th Street, north side, between Vyse and Bryant Avenues, showing the West Farms Presbyterian Church and grave yard. The church was built in 1815 and in its graveyard. The church was built in 1815 and in its graveyard are buried many Civil War Veterans. The monument is to the soldiers of the Civil War 1861-1865 and was erected in 1909.
Gift of Randall Comfort  1911
(2)
The West Farms Presbyterian Church, twenty-seven years later. Note the markedly changed exterior of the church and
its environs.
P. L. Sperr  April 16, 1938
